Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.server.controller

Class MatchController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.server.controller.MatchController
public class MatchController
extends java.lang.Object
The core of the match. It exposes a series of methods that allows the game to change state. Works in tandem with MatchModel.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • MatchController

      public MatchController​(java.util.List<ClientConnection> clientConnections) throws java.io.IOException
      Main constructor of the class. On creation asks all clients for their username.
      Parameters:
      clientConnections - list of clientConnections
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a communication error occurs

    • MatchController

      public MatchController() throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a dummy instance with no clientConnections associated.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if a communication error occurs

    • getMatchGods

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMatchGods​(java.lang.String roomMaster) throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the roomMaster for the gods to be played in the game and returns their names.
      Parameters:
      roomMaster - the name of the player who is roomMaster
      Returns:
      a list of names of gods
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on communication errors

      Parameters:
      player - the name of the choosing player
      availableGods - list of available god names
      Returns:
      the name of the chosen god
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - on communication errors

    • askQuestion

      public boolean askQuestion​(java.lang.String player, java.lang.String message) throws java.io.IOException
      Asks a question to a specific player. The player can respond with either yes or no.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who has to respond
      message - the text message containing the question
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating the answer (yes = true, no = false)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there's a connection error
